at.nineyards.anyline.camera

Class AnylineViewConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.nineyards.anyline.camera.AnylineViewConfig

  • public class AnylineViewConfig
extends Object
    A config class used to configure the AnylineBaseView.

      • getCutoutWidth

        public int getCutoutWidth()

      • setCutoutWidth

        public void setCutoutWidth(int cutoutWidth)

        Set the width of the cutout as a fix value relative to the preview size.

        This means if the preview is 720 wide and this is set to 360 the cutout will use the half of the width and the resulting cropped image will be 360 pixels wide too. (But the cutout view itself will be 720 wide on a 1080p screen if the view uses the whole width).

        Also note that the cutout will be limited to the views width (so if set to 540 and the view is only 480, it will be 480)

        Parameters:
        cutoutWidth - the width (related to the preview size not the view size)

      • getCutoutOffsetX

        public int getCutoutOffsetX()

      • setCutoutOffsetX

        public void setCutoutOffsetX(int cutoutOffsetX)
        Set the x offset of the cutout (+ moves the cutout further to the right, - to the left). Also relative to the preview size, see setCutoutWidth(int). The offset is limited to move the cutout to the start/end of the view.
        Parameters:
        cutoutOffsetX - the x offset for the cutout

      • getCutoutOffsetY

        public int getCutoutOffsetY()

      • setCutoutOffsetY

        public void setCutoutOffsetY(int cutoutOffsetY)
        Set the y offset of the cutout (+ moves the cutout further down, - further up). Also relative to the preview size, see setCutoutWidth(int). The offset is limited to move the cutout to the start/end of the view.
        Parameters:
        cutoutOffsetY - the x offset for the cutout

      • getCutoutStyle

        public AnylineViewConfig.CutoutStyle getCutoutStyle()

      • setCutoutStyle

        public void setCutoutStyle(AnylineViewConfig.CutoutStyle cutoutStyle)

        Set the cutout style.

        AnylineViewConfig.CutoutStyle.RECT

        Other things that should be set with this style:

      • setCutoutCornerRadiusInDp(int)
      • setCutoutStrokeWidthInDp(int)
      • setCutoutStrokeColor(int)

      AnylineViewConfig.CutoutStyle.IMAGE

      Other things that should be set with this style:

    • setCutoutDrawable(Drawable)

Parameters:
cutoutStyle - the desired style

    public float getCutoutRatio()

    Set the cutout ratio (width/height). The cutout will fill the defined width or maximum defined space and be in this ratio.
    Parameters:
    cutoutRatio - the desired cutout ratio (width/height)

  • getCutoutCropPaddingX

    public int getCutoutCropPaddingX()

  • setCutoutCropPaddingX

    public void setCutoutCropPaddingX(int cutoutCropPaddingX)

    The x padding in pixels that the image, that will be cropped out of the preview to match the cutout, should have in relation to the cutout size. If positive the cropped image will be smaller then the cutout and if negative the cropped image will be bigger.

    This should only be used in combination with a fixed width (that also fit on all supported devices), because this is a fixed value that will not be adjusted to anything.

    Parameters:
    cutoutCropPaddingX - the x padding inside the cutout used for the crop (negative means bigger crop than cutout)

  • getCutoutCropPaddingY

    public int getCutoutCropPaddingY()

  • setCutoutCropPaddingY

    public void setCutoutCropPaddingY(int cutoutCropPaddingY)

    The y padding in pixels that the image, that will be cropped out of the preview to match the cutout, should have in relation to the cutout size. If positive the cropped image will be smaller then the cutout and if negative the cropped image will be bigger.

    This should only be used in combination with a fixed width (that also fit on all supported devices), because this is a fixed value that will not be adjusted to anything.

    Parameters:
    cutoutCropPaddingY - the y padding inside the cutout used for the crop (negative means bigger crop than cutout)

  • getCutoutCropOffsetX

    public int getCutoutCropOffsetX()

  • setCutoutCropOffsetX

    public void setCutoutCropOffsetX(int cutoutCropOffsetX)

    The x offset in pixels that the image, that will be cropped out of the preview to match the cutout, should have in relation to the cutout. If positive the cropped image will be further right than the cutout view and if negative the cropped image will be further left.

    This should only be used in combination with a fixed width (that also fit on all supported devices), because this is a fixed value that will not be adjusted to anything.

    Parameters:
    cutoutCropOffsetX - the x offset to move the actual crop + right or - left

  • getCutoutCropOffsetY

    public int getCutoutCropOffsetY()

  • setCutoutCropOffsetY

    public void setCutoutCropOffsetY(int cutoutCropOffsetY)

    The y offset in pixels that the image, that will be cropped out of the preview to match the cutout, should have in relation to the cutout. If positive the cropped image will be further down than the cutout view and if negative the cropped image will be further up.

    This should only be used in combination with a fixed width (that also fit on all supported devices), because this is a fixed value that will not be adjusted to anything.

    Parameters:
    cutoutCropOffsetY - the y offset to move the actual crop + up or - down

    public int getCutoutOuterColor()

  • setCutoutOuterColor

    public void setCutoutOuterColor(int cutoutOuterColor)
    The color outside of the cutout area. This should usually have a transparency.
    Parameters:
    cutoutOuterColor - color outside of the cutout area (with transparency).

  • getCutoutFeedbackStrokeColor

    public int getCutoutFeedbackStrokeColor()
    If the #cutoutFeedbackStrokeColor is not set, this returns -1
    Returns:
    the the color for the cutout feedback, or -1 if not set

  • setCutoutFeedbackStrokeColor

    public void setCutoutFeedbackStrokeColor(int cutoutFeedbackStrokeColor)
    Sets a feedback colors for the cutout stroke: if set, the cutout will change its color if the scanning process has started, e.g. contours has been recongized and are being analyzed.
    Parameters:
    cutoutFeedbackStrokeColor - the color the cutout should stroke should get, if the scanning process has started

    set y offset for flash alignment
    Parameters:

  • isCancelOnResult

    public boolean isCancelOnResult()

  • setCancelOnResult

    public void setCancelOnResult(boolean isCancelOnResult)

    Set to true to stop the processing on result. (Default: true) If true you can start it again after a result with startScanning().

    THIS ONLY HAS AN EFFECT IS USED WITH AN ANYLINE MODULE

    Parameters:
    isCancelOnResult - true to stop the processing on result
